values:
Personally, I've always believed in UFOs. There was never a point in my life when I didn't believe that the universe was so vast that Earth held the only intelligent life out there.

Aliens are real --Just how people know the government is corrupt. Some people just don't look deep enough into it all... 

http://ufohq.org/

Just had to get that out. Night.
more to come...

Kinda odd making a new post every 12 months but here we go.

The Update:

  • I'm single now
  • My little girl is 18 months old (and a total angel)
  • Moved back in with my folks this past weekend
  • Finished probation a while back
  • Broke up with Heather (after 3 years)
  • Still working 40 hrs/ wk at Discount Labels in New Albany
If anyone remembers the old days of LJ I'm hoping to get back to that since I have so much more access to the internet. i ran out of journal space in my last journal so I have to put all my thoughts and ideas somewhere. Hence-- I'm back.

Hopefully people still remember me. If not I don't blame you. Here's to more time on LJ. Cheers!

If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all.
--Noam Chomsky

I finally finished the IOP therapy and am starting my 80 hours of community service. Things have been stressful with the baby girl coming VERY soon. Her full name is Kaelin Nicole Kitterman. Her new due date is February 9th. I'm very excited. Things have been good at home. My finacee, Heather, is a sweetheart and I can feel our love growing everyday. We're going to be getting married this Summer whenever she figures out a date.

A couple of shows coming up that I plan on attending:
  • March 29th in St. Louis, MO
Explosions in the Sky w/ some band called Lichen or something. They toured with Fugazi. I hear and it's experimental so it should be good times. I'm going with my old roommate from college, Zach.
  • April 19th in Louisville, KY
Megadeth, In Flames, Children of Bodom, Job For a Cowboy, and High on Fire
A big crew from work and my buddies are going and this will be the second time I see In Flames and Job For a Cowboy. Love some ln Flames!

Drinking my 6-pack of warsteiner I was just thinking...I don't know, if you've been reading my entries for a while you can probably see how they've changed over the years. I kinda wished I still had what I had back then, I think it's all just waiting to come back out again. I'm just becoming a better version of me I'm not changing for the worse.

I love watching UFO shows and sitting with my head phones on and just watching. Goes back to the days when we used to jam the History channel with Pink Floyd showing out WW2 archived footage...

Things are as good as they can be right now.

I'm now an IOP (Intensive Out Patient) group therapy in Jeffersonville, IN from 9-12 in the morning everyday for 4 weeks. I'm going into my 4th week right now. It's wild. Mostly people are 30-50 y/o who have ruined their lives from alcohol or drugs. There are some younger folks there, there an 18 y/o girl and boy and a 26 y/o women and me. That's as young as it goes... Heroine addicts, people who've lost EVERYTHING, alcoholics, you get the picture...

Work is good right now. I'm working my balls to the wall to try and get the promotions I need to support my new family...

About 12 of my buddies went to the Sounds of the Underground tour show at Waverly Hills a few months ago. Bands included: GWAR, Lamb of God, Shadows Fall, Behemoth, Chimaria, Job For a Cowboy, Darkest Hour, Goatwhore, Hatebreed, and others. The show was A-MAZ-ING! It will be the last show at Waverly Hills because the neighbors complained about the noise and whatnot. It was sweet none the less.

Life's pretty normal and we've figured that the baby is due around January 29th. That's it - good night!

Great news, I'm finally starting my working-class 40+/hr job a week at Discount Labels in New Albany. It'll be good to get this going and to stay busy. Just maybe it will keep me out of trouble. It's a warehouse job but I'm 100% ready to bust my ass to earn a living. All these years of part-time shitty-ass jobs have been boring and gave me WAY too much free time. The question is, is there a union and what kind is it?

My hours will be 3-11p.m. (2nd shift) so I won't have as much time to spend with Heather. I start at $9/hr but can move up to $22-26/hr in less than two years. That will be amazing.

I can see the changes I've made since I've got jail and trouble-making behind me now. I see that in February I'll have a brand new baby with my girlfriend and start an adult life. Getting married next summer is on the do list too...

My friends' band Buried Beneath Me is play at Uncle Pleasant's bar tonight at 7 in Louisville. If you're interested in a metal show, just give me a call. 972.2008.

Nothing else - maybe next time I'll have something entertaining to post. Cheers!

Wow, after a year of no updates, I don't know if I even remember how to update this bitch. Things have changed drastically since my last update...

I went got arrested a couple more times (for being an idiot)
I went to jail for 45 days
I fell in LOVE and having a baby in Feburary
I finally turned 21
I moved out of my house and into an apartment in town (Corydon)
Got two new jobs - My new one I start in a week or so @ Discount Labels (New Albany)
My Grandmother passed away, I love you!
Went to a SHIT-LOAD of concerts/shows
Drank a SHIT-LOAD of beer
Quit smoking the cannabis
Friends moved back to the area/Friends moved away to College
Sold my truck to pay bills
A bunch of other shit I can't remember....



I don't know if I'll end up keeping this thing updated. I don't even know if people still use these things anymore. I want to get the community - punkinfestation - running again, but I'll need help. I feel bad for neglecting it.

Shit, if anyone's reading this let me know you're still alive, I can't believe I'm doing this still - like it's a big deal or something...

Cheers!

"We can never know what to want, because, living only one life, we can neither compare it with our previous lives nor perfect it on our lives to come."


"There is nothing heavier than compassion. Not even one's own pain weighs so heavy as the pain one feels with someone, for someone, a pain intensified by the imagination and prolonged by a hundred echoes."

Things are the same really - I'm still stuck at Jay-C until March when I get my job at Caesar's back. Long story short... I fucked it up. If things don't work out at Caesar's I'll be moving to Florida with Matt (dieforyourself) and work with his Dad and Uncle framing houses by the beach. Mmm. Matt leaves next week for good and I'm really going to miss him.

I wish I had more time for new friends, *wink*. It seems like I can't even get time for even myself.... I'm trying to get my shit together, but I tend to take a long time doing that. It's already been 3 years since things started getting froggy and shit, but I try to stay optimistic.

Nothing more. Kick out the jams motherfucker! Cheers.

-- Wow. After probation went well, I came across this before going into work... --

BELGRADE, Mont. - Republican Sen. Conrad Burns (news, bio, voting record), whose recent comments have stirred controversy, says the United States is up against a faceless enemy of terrorists who "drive taxi cabs in the daytime and kill at night."

During a fundraiser Wednesday with first lady Laura Bush, the three-term Montana senator talked about terrorism, tax cuts and the money he has brought to his state. Burns is one of the more vulnerable Senate incumbents, facing a tough challenge from Democrat Jon Tester.

He has drawn criticism in recent weeks for calling his house painter a "nice little Guatemalan man" during a June speech. Burns, whose re-election campaign is pressing for tighter immigration controls, also suggested that the man might be an illegal immigrant. The campaign later said the worker is legal.

Burns, 71, also had to apologize after confronting members of a firefighting team at the Billings airport and telling them they had done a "piss-poor job," according to a state report. In July, the Hotshot crew had traveled 2,000 miles from Staunton, Va., to help dig fire lines for about a week around a 143-square-mile wildfire east of Billings.

At the campaign event with Bush, Burns talked about the war on terrorism, saying a "faceless enemy" of terrorists "drive taxi cabs in the daytime and kill at night."

Bush described Burns as a strong advocate for Montana farmers and families.

"In Washington, Senator Burns is a respected voice on the issues facing rural communities in Montana and across the nation," Bush told Burns supporters.

She also said Burns has been important in helping the president on key initiatives, such as tax cuts, and has supported the troops fighting in Iraq and the war on terror.

Things lately have been good, too much has happened for me and friends to fill this box full. Not that life is taking off and flying away or anything but it's at least moving in an foward motion.

This girl, I can't get her out of my head. Last night was good, but I wish things wouldn't have been as awkward as a drunk talking to someone sober. I was still happy to see her there. At first I couldn't tell if it was her, but my buddy yelled her name and she looked; that put a smile on my face.

and I'm heading home so Dad can show me how to use his big-ass mower he mows peoples lawns with. He's taking off a week because Tuesday he's going back to the doctor to get more tissue removed from his back to try and get the rest of the cancerous tissue... So I'm picking up all his different jobs on my days off. Things should go well.

Picked up a burned copy of the new Muse cd, Black Hole And Revelations. I can say that's it's good but nothing totally mind blowing. I'd say what sets this album apart from the others are solid drums. I found myself enjoying he catchy dance-like beats. Like a mix between Rush/Joy Division/Metallica '84-'89/techno/some mariachi band. It seems the lyrics have gone to a higher pitch,or they're just more annoying. I know I boasted about these guys with their Absolution album, but this one has about 3 or 4 solid tracks that I can actually listen to. I think filling a song with high-pitched vocals is a waste, I'd give the album a 7.1.



There. I think that's it. Hope things are well - Cheers.

All kinds of things going on today, it really felt good to get up early this morning...

Today is my Real Estate Salesperson exam in Evansville, IN, I'm a little nervous. I think I'll do well since I took the course for 27 fuckin' weeks straight.



I know everyone know what day it is. Blah, I plan on going to see The Omen with a few friends tonight but reading some of the reviews make me a little unanxious about going...

I'm out of subjects - but all you who haven't called me yet -- shame on you. Cheers.

It's like it's been raining for weeks now. It's muddy and wet everywhere.

This weekend went well, as planned. Nothing better could've came my way, I'm sure.

Everyone's back in town -- so that means you should call me.

I love checking things off my my to-do list. The next is try and save some money up for the tattoos I've been wanting to get since college.

Soulfly,Gizmachi,Thine Eyes Bleed and Incite play tomorrow at Bogart's in CInci. Once again something comes in my way. I have two more classes left and one is tomorrow.

Work at 3... then I'm going to watch, what everybody tells me is a good movie, Crash.

And last but not least -- I hope Thom knows what he's doing. I imagine it will be all it should be.

Well, well, well. It's been long enough since my last update, things have been as hectic as always. Just got off work and about to head to my Wednesday night rehab.

I've got a new 'spark in my heart.' Heh, I haven't felt this way for a long time. I'm going to call her again tonight. Prom is this weekend so I'll probably find time to go out with her this weekend. Too bad she goes to school in ther Fall. I'm optimistic though...

I picked up Pearl Jam's newest greatest hits album - "rearviewmirror". I'm a big Pearl Jam fan, so yeah, the cd kicks ass. Not only is it 2-discs but it has over 40 tracks. Boo yah!



I love this cd art, I can't find the one I have, so enjoy. Things are good for me, I'm actually writing in my journal instead of posting here. I'll do my best to keep it going here. I'm out shit to type about. Good night and cheers!

The 15th was my birthday so I'm 20 now, fuck yeah.. Things are good, nothing really to update. 

I've been drinking more lately, but not driving which is good. The rehab seems to be doing to opposite that it should. I understand what they say but I seem to just let it go when I drive away afterwards.

School in a few minutes - then to the store. Cheers.

It's been a few days since I last really updated. Work, school, rehab, and partyin' stuff my week like none other. The rehab thing is alright, besides being one of the youngest people in there. Mostly 35-50 y/o's...

Yesterday I purchased a new vehicle because Tuesday my old car was having bad engine trouble plus it's a piece of shit. It's been on it's last legs for around 6 months, I'm surprised it went this long. But here's a picture of the truck:


'04 Ford Ranger XL - 18,000 miles - $7K

I'm personally excited about it. I can't even show a picture of my old car, but It did take me all over the place and there's a lot of memories in it. I got $50 for it and it's being used for parts down on Hwy 135.

Don't forget!! on April 15th, besides being my birthday, is my buddies wedding and we're having a monsterous reception down at the Eagle's Lodge on Saturday. You can call me if you need to. I'm about to drive to Clarksville to get a cd player installed, Adios!

Very odd dream last night. It's those kind of dreams that remind me of where I've been and who was there. i think sometimes I need something/someone to remind me where I've been and all that.

I had my first day of probation last Tuesday I think. I have to return May 23rd. I've got 18 meetings I've got to attend at Blue River Services-some sort of victim's impact class. Hmm.

Things are well, I suppose, no class this week for spring break. Lots of things are on my mind, especially from last night's dream.



Thanks Dali.

Helen Thomas made a fool of our great president. If you can get thereplay of the conference I'd try and find it. I've never really seen Bush so put down and cynical.

--Check it out.

Did some googling for the occasion, just a few behind the cut.

Yo:

Meh, I missed the class by 10 points. Weak.  There's just too much pressure from my family right now. Asking "When do those Alcohol classes start?" or "When you thinking of taking the class again?" When I'm damn ready. Life's not bad, though, it's just a little unletting..

I'm either going on a date tonight or friday night with a girl I've known for a while. She's not my prefect match or anything, but it's hard to find a girl that's into all the shit you are. She is really cool though.

The Beatles have been playing mostly for the passed few days:
  1. The Magical Mystery Tour
  2. Hello, Goodbye
  3. Hey Jude
  4. Let It Be
  5. Sgt. Peppers Lonely Heart Club Band
  6. Norweigan Wood
  7. In My Life
  8. For No One
  9. Good Day Sunshine
  10. Happiness Is a Warm Gun
  11. The Long and Winding Road

That's about all I have on my mix tape. I'm ready to do something, but now I feel like I'm in a stalemate with myself. I think I will go on that date tonight, and if things don't work out tonight, we'll go Friday. I am ready...
There are places I'll remember
All my life though some have changed
Some forever not for better
Some have gone and some remain
All these places have their moments
With lovers and friends I still can recall
Some are dead and some are living
In my life I've loved them all

But of all these friends and lovers
There is no one compares with you
And these memories lose their meaning
When I think of love as something new
Though I know I'll never lose affection
For people and things that went before
I know I'll often stop and think about them
In my life I love you more

Though I know I'll never lose affection
For people and things that went before
I know I'll often stop and think about them
In my life I love you more
In my life I love you more

Very nice day outside today, it was a-maz-ing. Even got to play some pool ealier and go outside and throw the football around--which is odd for me.

Good news on my Real Estate class, I actually passed the 2nd exam! For that, tonight is a Jagermeister and Falls City night, along with some pool playing.
I've been listening to American Nightmare's Background Music album, again, as of lately:



AM/PM is, by far, the best of the album, I've had it on repeat for days now, it seems.

Sadly it's time to go off to class again. See ya on the flipside. I wish I had more..

Wow, what a day so far. Some of the weirdest dreams of my life have been in just the past 4 days, something is off, or on.

V-day was nothing special, again. I don't believe I've ever had a girl to buy for, as of yet. Just another day in the life I suppose.

I don't know what it is about the band, the muse, but I'm beginning to totally dig 'em. My buddy gave me the cd, Absolution, yesterday and I haven't got to take it out of my player yet. Something about it just makes me smile. I think I have something for pianos and keyboards in rock music. His voice reminds me so much of Thom Yorke it's uncanny.





I've been working out lately, which is really good for me. Eating right is starting to become habit instead of luck. I'm actually moving in the right direction.

I go to court on Monday, at 8 a.m. I'll most likely get probation for a year, so my smoking days will probably end. I desperately need to start new things and end a lot of the old.

Oh yeah, finding a girlfriend is also a must.

P.S. I totally kicked everyones ass in Texas-Holdem last night.

It's been at least a couple years since I've been to a funeral. Tom Landers, an old man that's been doing landscaping work for a long time for my family and business, funeral was today. He was 80. I'd only spoke with him, maybe, a half-dozen times but still felt like I knew him dearly. It makes me think of my funeral one day, hopefully in the far far future.

On the last passing my little sister went and hugged his wife and started crying. I could barely keep it together..

"To not think of dying, is to not think of living."

~Jann Arden

 "The safest course is to do nothing against one's conscience. With this secret, we can enjoy life and have no fear from death."

~Voltaire

--

Whew, work in a few minutes then par-tay time. Cheers for friends.

I've been thinking of people who are far away from here now. I debated on calling and pussied out. Sounds about right. I don't want to be some fool listening to my emotions.. From what I know what my heart says is usually wrong to ther rest of the world.

On a lighter note, In Flames put their new album out today. "Come Claritry". Boo Yah! Matt, Brad, and I went and bought it earlier today. It's as epic as usual, but I don't think it compares to their earlier work. It's a little bit better than "Soundtrack to Your Escape." I give it a 7.4. Here's the cover:

Off to food and class. Afterwards I'll drink away my sorrow with these:

"Keep America Beautiful."

Note: Union Made. Cheers.

First exam is in a few hours, I really do need to do well on this. I was trying to look up the monologue by Godspeed You! Black Emperor for the song 'Blaise Bailey Finnegan III', and I found it, right here. If you don't have the song, try and find it or go and buy it.  It's a pretty powerful song IMO.

I'm tired, wish me luck.

I'll even copy it  .

monologues - BBF3

this monologue takes the form of an interview with blaise bailey finnegan the third; the interviewer's words are in a stronger font, while BBF3's words are in a normal font.


well...where are you coming from?

...well...i don't like the way the country's ran, don't you know, and, erm...that's pretty much what i was expressing in my poem. the government...the american government - they're sneaky, they're very deceitful, they're liers, they're cheats, they're rip-offs. i mean, the american government is one systematic government that...that nobody can trust. i don't trust them myself.

and how long have you been writing for?

huh?

how long have you been writing for?

since i was four.

d'you do this sort of thing a lot, like, open-mic kinda questions?

oh i love open-mics, i love coming here to do open-mics, absolutely.

what kind of reactions d'you usually get?

usually, people are...are pretty much in agreement with what i'm saying.

we overheard you before talking about...you went to court today for a speeding ticket...?

that's accurate.

right. d'you wanna tell us that story?

yes, absolutely, i wouldn't mind telling you the story. erm...i went to court today for a speeding ticket, and i told the judge, erm..."let me tell you something, and you listen and you listen good, i'm only gonna say this one time and one time only, i don't repeat myself for nobody," i said. i says..."i'm here to pay a speeding ticket, not to listen to your lectures and hear you run your mouth for an hour." i says "i'm here to pay off my speeding ticket...and i'm here to get my fines out of the way and get the fuck to work." the judge says "you can't talk like that in my courtroom, you're in contempt of court." then i said...i told the judge, "if that's the best you can do, i feel sorry for you." i said "why don't you just shut your fucking mouth for once and listen." i said "i'm not gonna take any shit." i said "i'm gonna pay my speeding ticket like i said." i walked up to the god damn judge and i hand him my 25 dollars and i says "here's my money, now i am leaving."
and i left it at that...
...then, before i left, i turned around and told the judge "i'm here to state who i am and be honest with you." i said "if they thought i was dangerous on the road like you're trying to accuse me of, wouldn't they have taken my license when i first got it? yes they would. and the judge says "yeah, you have a point," he goes "you don't need to get loud," i said "don't get loud?" i says "i've got every right to get loud." i says "you can't do a god damn thing about it, because i'm expressing myself in your court, and there is nothing you can do about it. you think you're god because you have a robe and you can put people up the god damn river for 20 years? well you're not."
and i left it at that...

did you walk away?

yes i did...i don't like the judicial system, i don't like the government system, i don't like the police, i don't like anything to do with this country's government. i just don't like it, because...they're sneaky, like i said - they're deceitful, they're lying, they're cheats, the rip people off. that's the american government for you. america is a third world country, and people don't recognise it...and i think that that's pretty god damn sad, that they don't recognise their own country as a third world, third rate, third class slum.

well...d'you have any weapons?

yes, i do. i own a high-powered assault rifle, i own a 12-gauge double barrel shotgun, i own a regular shotgun, i own a regular hunting rifle, i own a 9 milimetre, a 357, a 45 handgun, a 38 special, and, erm...i own an m-16 fully automatic ground assault rifle...

d'you think things are gonna get better before they get worse?

no way. things are just gonna get worse and keep on getting worse. like i said, america's a third world country as it is and...and we're just basically in a hopeless situation as it stands.

what d'you think this country's gonna look like in the year 2003?

y'know, i'll tell you the truth - nothing against you guys, but i don't wanna answer that question because...i haven't even got a mind that's that...that inhumane.

are you ready for what's coming?

ready as i'll ever be.

most people aren't.

there's a little saying...dates back for generations...

go on...

be prepared for anything at any time from anybody, don't take no shit, always stand your ground. people wanna come up to me and run their mouth - guess what? i'll throw them through the fucking window...i won't think a thing of it.

would you mind reciting your poem for us?

not at all, i don't see why...i don't see why i couldn't.

there's an evil virus that's threatening mankind
it's not state of the art, it's a serious state of the mind
the muggers, the backstabbers, the two faced elite
a menace to society, a social disease
to brainwash the mind is a social disorder
the cynics, the apathy one-upmanship order
watching beginnings of social decay
gloating and sneering at life's disarray
eating away at your own self esteem
pouncing on every word that you might be saying
to attack someones mind is a social disorder
the constitution, the government, martial law order
superficially smiling a shake of the hand
as soon as your back is turned treason is planned
when every good thing's laid to rest
by the governments hate, by the constitution and their lies
and every time you think you're safe
and when you go to turn away
you know they're sharpening all their knives
all in your mind
all in your head
try to relate it
all in your mind
all in your head
try to escape it
without a conscience they destroy
and that's a thing that they enjoy
they're a sickness that's in all of our minds
they want to sink the ship and leave
the way they laugh at you and me
you know it happens all the time
but it only happens in your mind
the rats in the cellar you know who you are...
or do you?
watching beginnings of social decay...

thank you for your time

NOTE: "his" poem which he recites at the end of this monologue is, in fact, not a poem by him at all, but an almost straight recital of the lyrics to virus by iron maiden. "Virus" was written by Blaze Bayley, former Iron Maiden vocalist, but the man on the recording is not actually Blaze.

(huge thanks to lornicus, erik, andi, patrick and bert for their help with transcribing this monologue).

Fucking Colts lost yesterday, my biggest let-down all year, I can barely still believe it happened. FUCK.

Actually got out of the house for Matt C's b-day bash, only the crew. We got drunk and stupid like usual.

Painted this morning at a rental house and have work at 2, yay. I'm sore.

If there was one thing I could wish for right now, It'd be that the girls around here could actually not go around fucking every other boy they see. it makes me sick and I'm tired of being let down.

"It won't be long, we'll meet again."

My lawyer tells me today that my charge is being lessened to reckless driving, which is fantastic. Sadly to recieve my realestate liscense my charge can't being anything that is a "menace to the community". Hopefully I get get it lowered to running  stop sign of something stupid like hunting without a liscense.

I guess it helps to know people in the department, especially the prosecuter. Wish me luck.

What a beautiful day for January, right around 65 degrees. The sunset is fantastic!

I sat down and re-read henry David Thoreau's Walking today, it's a good reminder to not take things for granted and to seek a simplier life. Thoreau is by-far my favorite person, EVER.  There's a link for the read, if you haven't yet, please do so.



  • http://www.transcendentalists.com/walking.htm
And I'm off to class. Adios.

Dear corey,
Here is your horoscope
for Tuesday, January 10:

It's a good time to be ever the cockeyed optimist, no matter how unfortunate the circumstances may look on the surface. Your relentlessly upbeat -- but never saccharine -- attitude will be a self-fulfilling prophecy.

What a rainy day, i don't think it's quit since this morning. it usually puts a damper on my mood, but I've been feeling a lot different lately.

I put some Godspeed You! Black Emperor on my mp3 player today and was walking around outside work on my smoke breaks. Let me tell you, today is the perfect day for their music, but any day is really. There's this ledge/cliff thing I like to stand and think on. Today, standing, listening to their song 'Providence' took me back a little. What a beautiful song, I wish I'd had written it.

There's a show coming up at the end of the month at Bogart's I'd like to attend. It's Nile, Decapitated, With Passion, Hypocrisy, Raging Speedhorn and Soilent Green. Wow, should be an excellent show..

Last night I watched a show on History Channel about Edgar Cayce. I knew of him and that he was a prophet/psychic and what-not, but I'd never heard anything really in-depth about him. After that show i need to get any and all books about him. He makes me feel this sense, I don't know what it is. Here's some links you should definately check out in your free time:
  • www.cayce.com
  • www.are-cayce.com
I start my first day back to Real Estate school today, hopefully it won't be in vain. Katy Davis and Sarah Carver's boyfriend Eric are going to be riding up with me this year, which should be alot better than me being solo.

That's it for me today, see ya on the flip-side.

Happy New Year! Woo hooo. I had an amazing New Years, and I hope you did too. School starts up next Tuesday, wish me luck for the 2nd time around.

Got these gems with for the "holiday" season. Fuckers.

4.
I'd never seen them live before and I about shit me pants when I saw it. Boo yah!

3. Alice in Chains Greatest Hits 2, it's better than the first!

2. A couple of COLISEUM albums which totally rule along with the rest of FUGAZI's albums besides 'instrument'

1.And my pride and joy.

Nothing much, but better than nothing. Cheers.

WTF Myspace.

MySpace.Com - Undergoing Maintenance  
Site will be down for maintenance from 2:15AM PST to around 5:00AM PST. December 23, 2005.

It's fucking 9:09a.m. All I want for Christmas eve-eve is to look at myspace. Can't get nothin'.

Finally, the sun is shining. I'm about tired of overcast days and rain'sleet/snow/shit. Big 8 hours of work today, I only have a few more minutes to spare.

Nothing really to update besides that work sucks and there's a big party tonight. So, I'll leave you with some In Flames lyrics. While you're at it, go ahead and remember why In Flames owns you. Put the song in! The song for today:



In Flames - Another Day In Quicksand

The other side of the platinum door
another day in quicksand
Still feel close to nowhere
I hope this is the right way

How come you see me as an enemy?
We just think in different words

I was going to write out a whole post about Lamb of God, but their website has everything you need. It'd be a waste of my time.

-http://www.lamb-of-god.com/
-http://myspace.com/lambofgod

Last night was the night for Lamb of God, call it an epiphany moment, call it whatever you want. Thunderstorms, Tornado warnings, 30-50 mph winds, and a hail of rain...

I'll say it now. Go ahead and get all your metal albums out because you're going to have to throw them all away. If you haven't tapped into Lamb of God yet, you're missing the boat asshole. I don't care what you're heard your buddy say about them or what you even think. Go pick up their first album, as LoG, New American Gospel, and you're life will change.

You may listen to some pretty 'hardcore' bands, and this one should be added to your list.

I'm doing YOU a favor here, please. I just want a few people to comment back and say how much they agree. I haven't been more excited about a band. The lyrics are poetic if you read while you listen. If you want to go even cheaper than buying or listening to their cds, pick up their latest dvd, Killadelphia, it's like $9.

"...Leaning towards the dark side...this is grindcore and death metal for the hardcore kids..."

"...Harks back to the days when Slayer ruled the kingdom of metal with speedy riffs and nihilism....the sound is ferocious..."

11th Hour (my favorite song, from As the Palaces Burn, track 04)

"The hour of wreckoning draws near

Mark my words and remember me.

Take me under your black wings
Mark my words and remember me.
Destroyer of senses.
So take as needed for the pain
Another gray morning dawns across an ashen sky.
My sweet demoness beckons me
Ever again and again and again and again.
The dark mistress of many, beholden to none
My sweet demoness beckons me
Ever again and again and again and again and again.
Take me under your black wings.
Jacked up on the taste of self-destruction."

History

After moving from Denmark, Mike Tramp meets guitarist Vito Bratta and decide to form a band. After meeting drummer Nicki Capozzi and bassist Felix Robinson the band was named White Lion.

White Lion was signed by a small label called Grand Slam records in January 1985. While recording the song The Road to Valhalla, both Capozzi and Robinson left the band. Nicki Capozzi was replaced by Dan Spitz, and Felix Robinson was replaced by James Lomenzo. Within a month of joining, Dan Spitz left to become guitarist for Anthrax and was replaced by former Anthrax drummer Greg D'Angelo.

The band then finished their debut album, Fight to Survive, which was released on November 9, 1985. A few months later, Grand Slam records went bankrupt.

In 1986, White Lion, with a fictitious "female" member, had a brief part in the Tom Hanks/Shelley Long movie The Money Pit. Early in 1987, the band was signed by Atlantic Records. By then, their debut album was out of print and extremely hard to find.

On June 21, 1987, their second album, Pride, was released (the same day as Keel's Keel album, and Helix's Wild in The Streets) The first single from Pride was 'Wait/Don't Give Up, released on June 1, 1987. However, it took seven months before the song became a hit.

The Pride tour started in July 1987 as White Lion opened for Ace Frehley's 80s band Frehley's Comet. In September 1987, White Lion became the opening band for KISS (who had just started their Crazy Nights tour).

White Lion spent the rest of 1987 on tour with KISS. In January 1988 started opening for AC/DC on their Blow Up Your Video tour.

While opening for AC/DC, the Pride album and Wait single finally charted. Wait hit #8 on the singles chart, while Pride stalled at #11 on the album chart.

In August 1988, the album's second single "Tell Me" stopped at #58. Around the time this single was released, White Lion played at the Ritz club in New York City. Like Guns N' Roses, White Lion's show at the Ritz was filmed and later aired on MTV.

White Lion concluded the Pride tour by opening for Stryper from September 1988 to February 1989 during Stryper's In God We Trust tour. The "Pride" album's third single, When The Children Cry, made it to #3, making Pride one of about 18 hard rock albums to ever have multiple top 10 hits.

In August 1989, White Lion released their third album, "Big Game", a musically eclectic follow-up to "Pride" that featured the singles "Little Fighter," "Cry For Freedom," and a cover of Golden Earring's "Radar Love." As soon as the album went gold it slowly declined on the charts.

After 2 years of writing and recording, the new album, "Mane Attraction," was released in 1991. The album failed to chart, following the last two albums. It barely received any airplay due to the recent Grunge explosion. Greg D'Angelo and James Lomenzo soon left the band, but White Lion carried on with Tommy T-Bone Caradonna on bass and Jimmy De Grasso on drums. White Lion soon broke up, with their last show being held in Boston at the Channel in September 1991.

After White Lion

Mike Tramp went on to form Freaks of Nature. Freaks of Nature released three albums, "Freaks of Nature," "Gathering of Freaks," and "Outcasts." After Freaks of Nature split up, Mike Tramp went on as a solo artist. He has released five studio albums and one live album so far; "Capricorn," "Remembering White Lion," "Recovering the Wasted Years," "More To Life Than This," and "Songs I Left Behind" as studio efforts, with "Rock n' Roll Alive" as his sole live album.

James Lomenzo and Greg D'Angelo joined Zakk Wylde's band, Lynyrd Skynhead, which became the band Pride & Glory when Greg D'Angelo was replaced by Brian Tichy. Pride & Glory released one album, then James Lomenzo left the band. James went on to record and tour with ex-Van Halen frontman David Lee Roth and now tours with Zakk Wylde's band Black Label Society. Greg D'Angelo is now the new drummer for the band Anti Product.

Vito Bratta stayed with Atlantic Records to help produce a album for CPR and later tried to form a music group but failed and he has been out of the music business ever since.

Towards the end of 2003, Mike Tramp said that White Lion was planning to reunite. This statement was quickly denied by the other members.

Albums:

  • Big Game
  • Fight To Survive
  • Main Attraction
  • Pride
  • The Best Of White Lion a Greatest hits compilation
